website_summaries.verdict: A rugged plastic hitch step that can also protect your vehicle against scratches and dents.
pros: Helps protect your bumper against scratches and dents
Made of durable, lightweight plastic that holds up well over time
You can adjust the depth as necessary
cons: Some users say it feels a little flimsy when used as a step if there's a lot of weight on it

customer_reviews.title: Murdered a Buick Regal, you can’t even tell it took a hit.
customer_reviews.text: I got rear ended by a Buick Regal this morning. This product went over the bumper, through the grill, and took out the radiator. Not a scratch on my truck. I put in it a notch because the hole it was on got messed up pretty good. It has a small crack. People are complaining that it is all plastic. That’s the point! You want it to absorb the impact, and not mangle your frame. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: DerekNS74

customer_reviews.title: Bumper step saved my truck from any damage.
customer_reviews.text: I was hit in the rear while stopped at a light last week. The kid was rolling to a stop and texting at the same time. The hit was so hard it snapped the step off the hitch, leaving the residual insert. Absolutely no damage to the truck or the the other kid's truck. He was so shaken I just chewed him out for texting while in motion (he had immediately admitted to texting and did not see me.) and sent him on his way.
customer_reviews.author: ScoutGunner

customer_reviews.title: Picture says it all
customer_reviews.text: Ok this product saved me from savages who don't know how to park so glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Marium

customer_reviews.title: Good for "Bumps", Flimsy as a "Step"
customer_reviews.text: While I love this product in concept, the execution is marginal. The entire product, including the "shaft", is made of a resin (plastic) which is not very hard or stiff. This combined with the fact that it fits very loosely in the hitch receiver means that it twists when you step on it. Specifically, it feels flimsy, as a step, and I felt insecure on it, though I am sure it will work fine as a "bump" protector.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Parking by Braille
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. I have a 2004 Tundra without a backup camera so when I am backing into a parking spot with a wall, I can use this as a indicator of when I have fully backed into the spot. A sort of "parking by braille." It saves the back bumper from dents and dings. It is also a good step for getting into the bed of the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Hoopes

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT! Has protected my truck bumper several times because ...
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! Has protected my truck bumper several times because people in my area, 1) cannot park, and 2) do not respect other people's property. One person hit it while parking and I came out of the store to see their front license plate badly bent, but barely a scratch on the bump step and nothing on my bumper because the driver hit the step first.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Started out good, but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, put it on, and used it a few times. I'm just over 200 pounds and have to say that it didn't feel that sturdy when I stepped on it. Recently, something must have backed into me, or moved forward into me, as I came out and it was broken off. So, given that there is no other damage, whatever it was (or if it was someone just stepping on it without opening the tailgate), and the way it shows as snapped, makes it so I want a replacement but one that is actually sturdy and made well. I would NOT buy this again as it seems, to me, to have quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ron F

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, it works and looks fine on my 4Runner. I back up to a wall at work everyday so just in case.... I had to file (round off) each corner of the insert to fit into my receiver, Ive never run into this before as I have numerous types of hitches but no big deal. If its half as good as their form fitting floormats Im happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jarhed

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a small woman - 5'5" - and getting up into the rear of my Expedition (the Beast) was darned hard. So I started looking for a step that would go into my towing receiver. One fellow rating this one said it murdered a Buick - aaaallrighty, then! My bumper is protected from minor impacts, and I have a step up into the Beast! SCORE!!!! Feels stable underfoot, and it adjusts to be right up against your bumper, or a few inches out. BONUS ROUND - I show dogs, and getting them up into my minivan was easy - the Beast requires a ramp, and darned if this step doesn't support my ramp at exactly the right height!
customer_reviews.author: Deonaha Conlin

customer_reviews.title: Provides Protection, and step
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to provide some protection to rear end. We had somebody bump our Tesla at an intersection, Insurance paid, but still lots of hassle in getting repaired. This provides several inches of protection from minor bumps. Only minor issue is it does not go ALL the way into my receiver, the item bottoms out just before the final setting, so it sticks out about 1" further than I would prefer. but all else is good. Item is plastic, so It will only protect for minor bumps, which is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Step up to the winner
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, easily adjustable for the depth, quite sturdy and looks great on the truck. It blends it quite well and I have used it several times now and it holds the weight AND position as expected. Made in the USA and die-hard tough. I highly recommend this one as it does a great job of keeping the locking pin (separate item and purchase) back underneath the bumper. Does everything I expected it to and then some. Will act as a great bumper between the back of the truck and brick walls or other obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: r2

customer_reviews.title: This does a nice job of providing the step
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to step up on the back of my Subaru Forester XT. To get onto the roof and/or remove the antenna, the hatch prevents that. This does a nice job of providing the step. Don't forget the pin. I use a lockable one so I had to go to the local auto parts store. I also learned that there are TWO sizes of pins! Be careful to get the right size. It was nice to see several holes so the step can be positioned along the hitch.
customer_reviews.author: bjohn913

customer_reviews.title: Wiggles in receiver - Not very stable - Rocks back and forth when stepping on it
customer_reviews.text: In general, this is a handy device. I am keeping it really for one reason: it'll help protect my bumper if someone hits me or I back into something. CON: It isn't cut very well to have a good proportion to the size of the receiver. When you step on it, it rocks back and forth because there is give between it and the receiver. As such, it is NOT very stable. It's handy to step on, but you need to watch yourself or it will wobble you off to one side or the other.
customer_reviews.author: KeizerDad

customer_reviews.title: This thing saved my truck!
customer_reviews.text: Was rear-ended at 45mph (was going maybe 5-10mph), compressed and broke the bump step into 3 pieces but not a single scratch on my truck! Had it looked over anyway and confirmed nothing shifted or budged - this thing took the entire blow! Other car was pretty damaged. Was worth every penny for saving my truck. I also use it to climb into the bed all the time! Bought a second one the same day the accident occurred.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Nice add-on for my Tesla Model Y
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my Tesla Model Y since the hitch when uncovered is terribly ugly. Unlike many cars where the hitch is below the bumper, in this car's case it's in the middle of the bumper. Adding this step cleans up the look, while protecting the car (I live in downtown Chicago, so parallel parking is common, and this protects my bumper from another car)/
customer_reviews.author: P. Benario

customer_reviews.title: Great pricing, great product, but just looks weird on the vehicle at all times
customer_reviews.text: This product is great and deserves a 5 star. The pricing is the lowest I could find at the time of purchase (by almost $20) and it performs really well. Heck, it held my fatas*without any bending or anything. I would totally give it a 5 star just for that. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because it does look weird if left on the vehicle when not using. I had it on my rig for a couple days and couldn't get used to the look of it, so I removed it and put it in my trunk. Now i just put it on when I need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Eryck H.

customer_reviews.title: Breat Buy
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why I got this for 35 plus but consider it a great buy at that price. I would not however pay the Weather Tech suggested retail price it is after all molded plastic. I installed to protect non metal bumper but it is sturdy enough to stand on. I notice they are now making it much wider but I am happy with this size.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Make your step adjustable in height
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad this step is all plastic because it's light, can't corrode, and is easily removed or installed. However, when I plugged it into my trailer hitch it was too high so I made it adjustable by adapting my hitch, as shown in photo. I welded a 6" piece of 2" receiver tubing ($14) onto my hitch as shown. When I need to use the ball I just turn the plate it's bolted to 180 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy step.
customer_reviews.text: I would assume that if you are buying a step. Rated for what ever weight. And you weigh less than that weight and you step on said step it should not flex and feel like you might slip off. Buyers beware. I am a hvac contractor And bought this for a transit service van for easy step into the back. Needles to say I feel like I wasted my money and wish I had done more research. I’ll probably end up making my own step this winter out of a old hitch and sell this one to recoup my costs. The step is not a solid step. Has lots of flex @270lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weather Tech sets the bar high
customer_reviews.text: The very best step bumper on the market. You can save a few bucks buying cheaper but Weather Tech sets the standard. Spend a little more and you’ll be glad you did. I have had a car hit this step bumper in a parking lot and both cars were spared damage.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Dog

customer_reviews.title: Nice step and rear end protection
customer_reviews.text: It's a very solid step. I weigh 175 lbs and step on it all the time. I have a 2020 Toyota Tacoma TRD Off Road 4x4 and it fits perfectly. Use a locking pin so people don't steal it. I imagine if someone rear ends me this step will destroy their front end.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... one to my girlfreind's son)and I realy got a great deal on this one
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Bump step I purchased (gave my 1st one to my girlfreind's son)and I realy got a great deal on this one. Only $35.00! Simple installation and makes climbing into the bed of your truck a breeze! Also give you a little protection from people bumping you from the rear, when you come to a stop in traffic. This is a durable step, and being plastic, no worries about rust!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Good but has a little lateral wobble
customer_reviews.text: So far it's exactly what I needed. It's a step into and out of the backdoor of van. However, i've noticed that is has a little lateral wobble if you do not put your foot right in the center. So far this hasnt been an issue, but I am concerned it could fail over time.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Epperly

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic. Held up to jumping on it.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy it because a reviewer noted that it was plastic. But it is hard solid plastic. So I installed it, jumped up and down on it trying to break it on its ends and it held up. That said, I'm 155 pounds so maybe one of you bigger guys can give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Fhteacher

customer_reviews.title: Seems strong but made of plastic
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought these were made out of rubber from the commercials I have seen advertising them but is actually made of a hard plastic , it’s seem sturdy enough as I stand on it all the time and it doesn’t flex or bend .
customer_reviews.author: JRod

customer_reviews.title: Glad I finally bought
customer_reviews.text: Been ‘hovering’ on this item...when it periodically came into my attention. Glad I finally bought. I hadn’t realized that it had some flex (that it isn’t metal), which can eliminate or lessen any jarring contact. I have many of WeatherTech’s products...they meet many of my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Carlito

customer_reviews.title: Functions as designed
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. This one is a replacement for the one that some moron ruined by backing into me and decided not use rheir brakes. Well they fared much worse than I did. While the bumpstep was broken in two by the impact, my SUV suffered no danage, this product did its job!
customer_reviews.author: TED T.

customer_reviews.title: it'll pay for itself
customer_reviews.text: I put it on my jeep and forgot it was there but its held up like a champ and even accumulated a bunch of little scratches that could've been damage to my spare tire if it wasnt there. its alittle expensive but very useful and I wouldnt go a day without it. make sure to buy a locking hitch as well don't be stupid theres a reason these things always pop up on ebay used.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Ray K

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't interfere with my parking sensors
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this, I was somewhat concerned that it might affect my backup/parking sensors. Thankfully, I have not had any issues and the step is working just as I hoped (protecting my bumper cover from other cars). For the record, I installed this on 2016 GMC Yukon Denali.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.  Heat is not its friend
customer_reviews.text: very easy to install and works great for what I intended it to do (more to protect my bumper in the city). I had parked in the sun one sunny hot day in the MD/DC/VA area, and the step twisted more than I was expecting to wash the top of the suv.
customer_reviews.author: P. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Easily worth the money if it saves just one dent
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and looks really nice. Only time will tell if it actually works. Just get the locking pin for it. Amazon had that and another pin that should be ordered together. I have no idea what I'm going to do with the second pin now so save the money there. I bought a second of these amount 9 months after my first one for my second vehicle. I also considered the Beaver step as it seams to be built very well. My only concern there was the rattling that some people described. Have to say the Bump Step is very quiet on both my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: As Promised
customer_reviews.text: Bought it more than two years ago and it’s excellent. It’s so excellent actually, that we got rear-ended hard one time ($9000 in damage) and it didn’t even crack. Color is not fading and overall I really couldn’t expect more.
customer_reviews.author: Eyal T.

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive- does not come with the pin necessary to secure it.
customer_reviews.text: The price seemed good, but it does not come with a pin/lock so I had to purchase one elsewhere for $15. This made the produce more expensive than expected. Additionally, it is not very sturdy when I stand on it and I'm only 125 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.

customer_reviews.title: I like its light weight and the utility of it being ...
customer_reviews.text: I like its light weight and the utility of it being a step. I didn't like the idea of carrying around heavy trailer hitch all the time. I believe it's design also offers superior low speed impact protection over a ball hitch. I really don't have any grips so far. Don't forget to get a lock to prevent it being stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Don Raper

customer_reviews.title: I installed this to protect my bumper
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of getting rear ended and people who love to tap my bumper as they park. The last vehicle had all sorts of dents and scrape off paint because people are not careful. I’m hoping this will stop anymore bumper damage from people who park or try to rear end me.
customer_reviews.author: City Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Durable but flexes
customer_reviews.text: I needed a step up bumper for easier entry into my truck camper. We are fans of WeatherTech floor mats and decided to give this product a try. Fits a little loose into the 2" receiver and definitely flexes with body weight on the step when in use. A bit concerning at first but definitely strong and light. Seems as if it would absorb a lot of shock if the bumper was the first thing to come into contact with something while backing up. Also is a bit pricey for a molded piece of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bump protection weather tech
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking for accessories for my truck, I found this. In my personal experience with Weather Tech products, is an excellent brand. Now I brought a bump protection for my new Toyota Tacoma.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Martinez Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Buy it before your bumper gets dinged up
customer_reviews.text: You can’t lose with WeatherGuard. These are still $50 in auto parts stores. People always mash my bumpers when trying to parallel park behind or in front of me. This will save my brand new chrome bumper from getting dinged.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Brian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much what I expected. Please make sure you have the right size hitch for this product. Also, please note that you also need a bolt for it and I recommend a locking bolt. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: William Wilder

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT FOR ME TO INSTALL AND REMOVE AS NEEDED. I AM 71 WITH A BAD BACK AND LEGS AND CANNOT CLIMB UPON BUMPER OF OUR RAM PICK UP NOR CRAWL ONTO THE TAILGATE WHEN IT IS OPEN. THANKS FOR THIS COOL STEP
customer_reviews.author: Wilma McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: It works amazing as a foot rest to put on your golf ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my dad, it is used as a step in the rear hitch. It works amazing as a foot rest to put on your golf shoes- i bought one for myself to reach my roof box. Weather Tech is quality as well
customer_reviews.author: CarGuy 67

customer_reviews.title: After one year, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my Tacoma, love it. Strong plastic, hasn't been damaged yet. Of course, it hasn't been bumped yet (knock on wood), and I will update my review if it ever happens. So far, I can recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee

customer_reviews.title: Best solution I’ve found
customer_reviews.text: A back saver! I use it as a temporary platform as I lift an 80 pound case into my high SUV cargo space. Short lift while I stand, then tilt it up across the cargo edge and in. I haven’t found a simpler solution. Thanks very much!
customer_reviews.author: macuaig

customer_reviews.title: Save your bumper, and get a step as a bonus!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a hitch, put this in it. This will protect your bumper from all the dings you usually get from cars bumping you when they park. It also acts as a step (which I consider a bonus feature). It is made out of resin, so if you step on the edge, there is a bit of flex. BUT - it you occasionally have to "park by feel" this saves your bumper as well as the guy behind you.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: flimsy. if you step on one side, the ...
customer_reviews.text: flimsy. if you step on one side, the bump step will lean from 90deg flit to at least 135 deg angel down.. You get the feeling you are about to fall off
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Hope to Never Find Out if This Works
customer_reviews.text: This works well as a step, looks nice; hope to never find out if it will minimize any damage in the event of a rear end collision.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Love the Bump Step
customer_reviews.text: The bump step fits perfectly in the receiver on my 2007 Toyota 4Runner. I had another receiver cover, but I backed into something and it got bent, then it disappeared after going through the car wash. I like that objects will hit the bump step first-- not the bumper. I have not used it as a step yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I like the step. It makes it easier to get into the back of the truck bed. Used it in wet weather and it has good grip.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: a nice extra step
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice extra step to have for a truck. I extended mine out a little to detour tail gaters and works awesome
customer_reviews.author: jeff t.

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy step
customer_reviews.text: It seems very sturdy. Work great as a step and a place to tie shoes. Most important, it acts as a 'bumper guard' if someone rear ends me. Hope that never happens, but one never know.
customer_reviews.author: Snobot

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Good added protection from minor bumps to avoid bumper damage. The step design is great to reach the roof when washing it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think I need something more rugged
customer_reviews.text: Not quite up to Weathertech quality...by design. The fit is loose in a Curt receiver....Electrician tape tightens this up. But the feel is soft and makes me want to always stand in the middle. I weigh about 180 lbs....so if you weigh less...this might be just fine. Rubber over-mold on steel would be far better.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Bump Step
customer_reviews.text: So far all I've used this for is a step, and it's really handy. It handles my weight with very little flex. I hope not to test the bump part of it but I think it will hold up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used and abused-still on the job.
customer_reviews.text: Hangs on the back of a 1-ton truck. Some very large guys have used it to step up into the truck and it’s held up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty much like they said but if you are doing ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty much like they said but if you are doing to use it for a stepping up stair, you have to be careful if you weigh over 200 lbs. My just about threw me when I put my weigh other than dead center. That's the reason I bought it, so I'm a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Folds

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It makes it so much easier to get in the back of the truck when the door is closed. Also it will help if someone decides it's ok to bump me from the back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: I like it enough to have purchased another one because it ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as tough as I expected, especially in cold weather. Advertised as a step/bump stop, only the step is appropriate. You bump it even genitally, in cold weather, you'll find it broken in half on the ground. I like it enough to have purchased another one because it is an excellent step for my Pickup. But I make sure I never bump it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Prescott

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: only good in winter or fall above 80 degrees when you step on it . it bends due to heat and forget about mid 90 it starts to melt due yourself a favor buy anything else . buy steel
customer_reviews.author: C. Spagnoletti

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: watched a buddy's car get rear-ended (about 10 miles an hour) with no damage... bought one the next day for myself as he bought a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: GatorBait

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Helps me to rise up and to look over the roof when washing and waxing my 2017 Mazda CX 5 GT. I've yet to see one of these on anyone's car but my own. Makes my vehicle stand out among the crowd.
customer_reviews.author: Chevere

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and get it
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect on my Winnebago Travato. Gives me a little piece of mind when reversing and is perfect for trying to load or make the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Blue View

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have heard nothing but good things about this item. Hopefully I can keep the 5 Star rating ! This item keeps the 5 stars ! Saved my rear bumper at least twice already ! It’s been over two years since I installed this product on my truck and it still looks great and saved my rear bumber from a lot of damage !
customer_reviews.author: NYB

customer_reviews.title: It's a high price for a piece of molded plastic/rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a high price for a piece of molded plastic/rubber... but it does the job. It's helpful to have a step up further back from the bumper step. I use it with a locking pin so that it's not too tempting to "borrow".
customer_reviews.author: Monday Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking step no metal no rust. Hard Polymer
customer_reviews.text: I like this step. It helps me to clean the top of my 4Runner. I like having the step just in case someone wants to tap into me, they will hit the step before my bumper. Piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: MADMAXJR

customer_reviews.title: Solid little helper step
customer_reviews.text: I use this on a lifted 4runner and it works perfectly to get to the rear of the roof cage. Likes: light, solid (though I agree with other reviewers to step in the middle and don't tempt the edge boundaries - the not-so-good flex is obvious), useful, inexpensive bumper protection, nothing to rust. Dislikes: None come to mind - just make sure you order properly if you don't have a hitch pin - the cheapest comes without.
customer_reviews.author: monphom

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks good.  But a bit over priced IMHO
customer_reviews.text: I like this step. The bumper function is nice if you mess up. It gives you a little sacrificial room before the expensive parts get bent. The step is functional. It looks nice. It is however just a piece of molded plastic. So don't be expecting a whole lot. It is a bit over priced IMHO. But it makes an otherwise unsightly hitch look better when the receiver isn't needed.
customer_reviews.author: Diver165

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea Step
customer_reviews.text: I really like this step. I would like to see a drop version available for taller trucks.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Bump Step - OK
customer_reviews.text: Jury is still out. Did not realize it was not a metal product when I bought it. Write up/Description on the web was not clear about this. Appears to be a type of resin/plastic. So far so good but will see how it holds up. Convenient step, like that aspect very much.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Hollister

customer_reviews.title: Good bumper for backing into a pole
customer_reviews.text: Robust and fits well. Good bumper for backing into a pole. Protects against dirt in the hitch, and works as a step, too. And easy to see in the backup camera.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Great step
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this product. Very light but very sturdy. You have to buy the hitch pin to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: steves119

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. My tow hitch is after market so I think the bump step will be too low to stop a car from hitting my bumper. It’s still worth a try though.
customer_reviews.author: CW Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Holds me (300 lb)
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Holds me (300 lb). Protects the back end of my wife's 2016 GMC Yukon Denali. I cut her fancy paint-matched plastic hitch cover to allow for this bumper. Looks nice, and now she can back into concrete walls all she wants!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This is a great concept! I drive a 2015 Dodge Ram and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept! I drive a 2015 Dodge Ram and have to frequently get in and out of the truck bed. This makes a perfect step. I have had my back bumper kissed a few times in slippery conditions and this will help to absorb that if it happens again. I also have a new driver in the family so I am glad to know that is there in case of a mishap while backing up.
customer_reviews.author: vizslafamily

customer_reviews.title: A Good Looking Step
customer_reviews.text: This might be a bit overpriced and overrated, considering it's all plastic. It may hold up if it's not left installed and subject to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now my husband can reach to top of the Jeep
customer_reviews.text: We are vertically challenged and I bought it for my husband so that he can reach the top of our jeep to either stow camping equipment or our bicycles. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: It is heavy duty plastic, not metal but it works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have this on the back of my Tacoma. Makes stepping up easier. Also looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Durable.  But, stuck out too much.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality WeatherTech product. Just stuck out too much even with the unit all the way in.
customer_reviews.author: Mui

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted, and typical WeatherTech perfection.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and expected from WeatherTech. This step meets all my needs and looks great tool. And better pricing through Amazon than I could find anywhere online. Installation makes it easy to wash the roof of my truck. I made sure to use a lock to prevent theft. If everyone knew how good these things were they'd be stealing them no doubt!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good useful and we'll made
customer_reviews.text: Weathertech makes good substantial products and this meets it's standards. This will make reaching into the back of our raised truck a lot easier and safer.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping it would protect bumper from constant hits due to parking, it’s doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: Rr

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR FULL SIZE VEHICLE
customer_reviews.text: To small for on pick up. If I didnt throw the packaging away I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Hd9claws

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: works as described. great for getting in the bed safely and sure footed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great, but no so good on a Chevy Z-71
customer_reviews.text: It works great, but no so good on a Chevy Z-71. The Z-71 hitch is almost too high to use as a step, and then only for accessing the roof. To access the interior, like an Orvis Fly Rod Rack, a folding step stool works better.
customer_reviews.author: GJ Colorado -

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my bumper safe in Wawa parking lots!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Does not interfere with my back up camera/alarms/sensors/blind spot assist/or trailer hook up on my 2016 f150 lariat.
customer_reviews.author: Adam W

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was installing a hitch on my Dodge Nitro. When I first opened the box and held the step, I honestly believed I was sold a cheap piece of plastic. After actually using it though, I found it to be more sturdy than I originally thought. Overall I believe this to be a good purchase. I only wish it was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This bumper step is very sturdy and has several holes for adjusting. I love it and am very happy with it. I would purchase another if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and solid step
customer_reviews.text: I bought this step so I can wash and load gear atop my 4Runner. It’s perfect! I weigh 220 lbs and it’s solid. Also, I was rear-ended at a stop light and this step saved my bumper. The step sustained a few barely noticeable gouges, but otherwise all is good. I highly recommend this step.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Bumper & Step all in One
customer_reviews.text: Let's start out by saying , WHAT A GREAT IDEA. This step/bumper is fantastic. High quality product. Nice fit. I bought a pin lock with it. I slid this in my 2inch hitch and increased the value of my car. This Extra protection is well worth the money. USA QUALITY
customer_reviews.author: RIchard ..Senior citizen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Hard plastic but durable. Had this on my Sequoia for 4 years and has held up well. Mainly got this to prevent people from hitting the bumper when parked.
customer_reviews.author: Abrama

customer_reviews.title: Weathertech is the best
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Looks great and is incredibly functional. It is made of a composite material, so it shouldn't rust, or bend and it seems very sturdy when standing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bumper for a garage owner.
customer_reviews.text: I often back my vehicle in my garage for parking. Even with the back up camera there are times you over do it. This little bumper has saved me well over $1,000.00 in repairs considering fiberglass, backup sensor replacement, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Loose and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Fit is loose in factory f150 receiver hitch! Had to jam a flat wrench under it to make it stop wiggling! Feels flimsy when I step on it. Would return, only plastic packaging was destroyed opening it. Can not recommend this product! Look elsewhere !
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Fine for what we need but it is plastic and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fine for what we need but it is plastic and has some give to it when you stand on it. Would imagine that someone on the heavier side would not feel very comfortable standing on this.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie O

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to keep idiots who can't drive away from my bumper. It's the perfect no-rust solution. My neighbor saw it and bought two for his trucks to replace his rusting metal ones. I put DOT reflective tape on it to provide more visibility
customer_reviews.author: Dovetail

customer_reviews.title: 2015 Buick Enclave
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Just as expected and worked perfectly for me as a step for my 2015 Buick Enclave which allowed me to reach the lock on the back of our cargo carrier. The 4 star for sturdiness is because it flexes some when standing on it, but that is probably by design.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Easily can climbed into my truck for unhauling when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: As we get older one does need a little help getting up into the back of your truck. Perfect gift for the man in your life and for yourself if you need the extra help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great produce
customer_reviews.text: Just what my dog needed go get into the Jeep
customer_reviews.author: Richard E.

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Much better than my old hitch which was rusting badly. Only got it for bumper / rear end protection, but really helpful to stand on and get to the top of the truck when washing.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Confused
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Weather Tech Bump Step in the Mail it came with everything but the pin to attach it. Why weather tech i thought was a good brand. but to not include a pin for installation is sad.
customer_reviews.author: Loyd

product_meta.title: WeatherTech 81BS1 Macneil Automotive Bump Step
product_meta.description: It is the best step-bumper protection available against bumps, dents and scratches to your vehicle's bumper due to careless drivers.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars933 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
